author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm, apparently if you submit a PR that changes an EIP author, the bot will merge it if you are the *new* author?  <https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3040>

author: sky.cactus
content: In this case, I think it is *probably* fine as I think that is the same person... but that is a pretty big security issue I think?

author: sky.cactus
content: Specifically, I tend to ignore PRs that are auto-merged, so such a change would likely slip past me.

author: sky.cactus
content: How do other editors feel about renaming the `Implementations` section to `Reference Implementation`?

author: sky.cactus
content: I frequently see people use the Implementations section as just a means of advertising their thing by dropping in an external link.  In most cases, I think just leaving out the section is most appropriate, but at the moment I don't really have much a position to stand on since the section is (for historic reasons) meant to be links out to external implementations.
